channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for ND
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for ND

item.title: Report E-2025020082
item.description:
Report E-2025020082

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-02
  • City: VALLEY CITY
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LOVE'S TRAVEL STOPS & COUNTRY STORES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 100-gallons of diesel fuel was released from a tanker filling up the underground tank due to a possible overfill. The release impacted asphalt, concrete and snow. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. Baranko Bros deployed absorbents throughout the impacted areas. Baranko Bros confirmed the material has affected the soil and rock area, with diesel pooling beneath the rocks. Baranko Bros used a sweeper to work on the oil dry that was deployed. Additional remediation is scheduled for spring 2025, when temperatures rise.
